Une formation arrondie anéchogène homogène, à paroi fine et régulière, avasculaire au Doppler avec un renforcement postérieur siégeant à 10H6cm du mamelon droit, mesurant 12x12x10 mm soit 0,78 ml de volume.
Une absence d’anomalie des canaux galactophoriques, ni d'épaississement des crêtes de Duret.
Une absence d’adénopathie axillaire. 

CONCLUSION
Arguments écho-mammographiques d’un kyste simple infracentimétrique du QSE à 10H6 cm du mamelon gauche : anomalie classée BIRADS 2.
Sein gauche harmonieux sans lésion suspecte : classé BI-RADS 1.

report:
Renseignements cliniques :  Ecoulement mammaire

RESULTATS

Mammographiquement, il est noté :
Des seins de volume symétrique, denses hétérogènes type C de la classification de BIRADS.
Une absence d’anomalie du revêtement cutané et du mamelon. 
Une absence d’opacité anormale des seins.
Une absence de calcification pathologique.
Des creux axillaires libres.

Ultrasonographiquement, on note :
Deux formations arrondies anéchogènes avec renforcement postérieur, à paroi fine et régulière, avasculaire au Doppler couleur siégeant dans le quadrant supéro-interne (QSI) du sein droit à 2H3 cm puis 2H4 cm du mamelon, mesurant respectivement 7x6 mm et 5x4 mm.
Une dilatation bilatérale des canaux galactophoriques mesurant entre 3 mm et 4 mm de diamètre, sans matériel endoluminal.
Une absence d’adénopathie axillaire. 

CONCLUSION
Arguments écho-mammographiques de kystes infra centimétriques du QSI du sein droit et d’une ectasie canalaire retro-aréolaire bilatérale sans matériel endoluminal : anomalies bénignes classées BIRADS 2.
translation:
Clinical Information: Nipple discharge

FINDINGS

Mammography reveals:
Symmetrically sized breasts with heterogeneously dense tissue, classified as type C according to BIRADS.
No abnormalities of the skin or nipple.
No abnormal breast opacities.
No pathological calcifications.
Clear axillary regions.

Ultrasound findings include:
Two round anechoic formations with posterior enhancement, thin and regular walls, avascular on color Doppler, located in the upper inner quadrant (UIQ) of the right breast at 2 o'clock, 3 cm and 4 cm from the nipple, measuring 7x6 mm and 5x4 mm respectively.
Bilateral dilation of the milk ducts measuring between 3 mm and 4 mm in diameter, without intraluminal material.
No axillary lymphadenopathy.

CONCLUSION
Echo-mammographic evidence of sub-centimeter cysts in the UIQ of the right breast and bilateral retroareolar ductal ectasia without intraluminal material: benign findings classified as BIRADS 2.

report:
RADIOGRAPHIE DES SINUS (BLONDEAU)

Indication : Rhinorrhée + céphalées

- Radiologiquement, on note un épaississement en cadre de la muqueuse du sinus maxillaire droit.
- Opacité du sinus maxillaire gauche surmonté d’un niveau clair.
- Opacité du sinus frontal gauche.
- Transparence normale du sinus frontal droit.
- Intégrité du cadre osseux péri sinusien.
- Absence d’anomalie de la cloison nasale.



CONCLUSION


 Aspect radiographique d’une sinusite bi maxillaire collectée à droite et d’une sinusite frontale gauche.
translation:
SINUS X-RAY (WATERS VIEW)

Indication: Rhinorrhea + Headaches

- Radiologically, there is noted thickening of the mucosa lining the right maxillary sinus.
- Opacity in the left maxillary sinus with an air-fluid level.
- Opacity in the left frontal sinus.
- Normal transparency of the right frontal sinus.
- Integrity of the surrounding bony framework of the sinuses.
- No abnormalities of the nasal septum.

CONCLUSION

 Radiographic appearance consistent with bilateral maxillary sinusitis with fluid collection on the right and left frontal sinusitis.

report:
Indication : AVC
Technique :    Acquisition réalisée sans injection 

Résultat :
 La fosse postérieure est sans  anomalie.
 A l’étage sus –tentoriel :
Hyperdensité parenchymateuse capsulo-thalamo-lenticulaire gauche de 59mmx45mx27mm entourée d’une collerette hypodense avec effet de masse sur le ventricule latéral gauche.
 Pas de collection pathologique péri-cérébrale.

Conclusion :
Hyperdensité parenchymateuse capsulo-thalamo-lenticulaire gauche de 59mmx45mx27mm entourée d’une collerette hypodense avec effet de masse sur le ventricule latéral gauche : aspect traduisant une lésion d’AVC hémorragique par rupture probable des artères perforantes (HTA).
Fosse postérieure normale.
translation:
Indication: Stroke  
Technique: Imaging performed without contrast injection  

Findings:  
- The posterior fossa is unremarkable.  
- Supratentorial level:  
There is a hyperdense lesion in the left capsulo-thalamo-lenticular region measuring 59mm x 45mm x 27mm, surrounded by a hypodense rim, with mass effect on the left lateral ventricle.  
No abnormal pericerebral collection is observed.  

Conclusion:  
Hyperdense lesion in the left capsulo-thalamo-lenticular region measuring 59mm x 45mm x 27mm, surrounded by a hypodense rim, with mass effect on the left lateral ventricle: findings suggestive of a hemorrhagic stroke lesion likely due to rupture of perforating arteries (hypertension).  
Normal posterior fossa.

report:
Renseignements cliniques : Mictions rapprochées (hypertrophie bénigne de la prostate)
Technique : Réalisation de l’examen à l’aide d’un transducteur de 3,5 MHz

RESULTATS
L’examen ultra-sonographique réalisé en sus pubienne objective une glande prostatique de taille augmentée dont la biométrie est de : 
64 mm de hauteur
61 mm de largeur
58 mm d’épaisseur, soit un volume de 117 cm3. 
Son échostructure est hétérogène remaniée par de multiples calcifications et ses contours sont réguliers. 
Le bas fond vésical est surélevé par une protrusion intra vésicale du lobe médian sur 8 mm.
Les vésicules séminales sont sans anomalie.   
Les reins sont de morpho-biométrie consignée dans le tableau ci-dessous :
Reins
Hauteur (mm)
Largeur (mm)
Epaisseur (mm)
Droit
92
45
40
Gauche
94
46
39

Conservation de la différenciation parenchymosinusale et corticomédullaire.
Pas d’anomalie des cavités pyélocalicielles ni image de lithiase.  
On note deux formations arrondies anéchogènes homogènes, aux contours réguliers avec renforcement postérieur, polaire supérieure et para pyélique du rein droit, mesurant respectivement 28 mm et 23mm de grand axe.
Vessie de bonne capacité, de contenu transonore alithiasique, à paroi épaissie de façon diffuse et régulière mesurée à 10 mm.  
Résidu post mictionnel non significatif.
CONCLUSION
Arguments ultrasonographiques d’une hypertrophie prostatique hétérogène de 117ml de volume avec un IPP de grade II responsable d’une vessie de lutte sans retentissement sur le haut appareil urinaire : à corréler aux PSA.
Kystes simples rénaux droits.
Rein gauche et vésicules séminales normaux.
translation:
Clinical Information: Frequent urination (benign prostatic hyperplasia)  
Technique: Examination performed using a 3.5 MHz transducer  

RESULTS  
The suprapubic ultrasound examination reveals an enlarged prostate gland with the following dimensions:  
- Height: 64 mm  
- WiRXh: 61 mm  
- Thickness: 58 mm, resulting in a volume of 117 cm³.  
Its echotexture is heterogeneous, altered by multiple calcifications, and its contours are regular.  
The bladder base is elevated by an 8 mm intravesical protrusion of the median lobe.  
The seminal vesicles appear normal.  
The kidneys have the following morpho-biometric details:  

| Kidneys | Height (mm) | WiRXh (mm) | Thickness (mm) |  
|---------|-------------|------------|----------------|  
| Right   | 92          | 45         | 40             |  
| Left    | 94          | 46         | 39             |  

Preservation of the parenchymal-sinus and cortico-medullary differentiation.  
No abnormalities in the pyelocaliceal cavities or signs of lithiasis.  
Two rounded, anechoic, homogeneous formations with regular contours and posterior enhancement are noted at the upper pole and parapelvic region of the right kidney, measuring 28 mm and 23 mm in their longest axis, respectively.  
The bladder has good capacity, is anechoic and free of stones, with a diffusely and regularly thickened wall measuring 10 mm.  
Post-void residual volume is not significant.  

CONCLUSION  
Ultrasonographic evidence of heterogeneous prostatic hypertrophy with a volume of 117 ml and an IPP of grade II, resulting in a compensatory bladder without impact on the upper urinary tract: correlation with PSA is recommended.  
Simple right renal cysts.  
Normal left kidney and seminal vesicles.

report:
Indication :  Colopathie fonctionnelle + kyste ovarien droit
Technique : Réalisation de l’examen à l’aide d’un transducteur de 3.5 MHz
 
RESULTATS :
Etage abdominal 
- Le foie est de taille augmentée mesurant 155 mm de hauteur sur l’axe rénal droit, de contours réguliers et d’échostructure homogène.
- La veine porte et ses branches, la VCI et l’aorte abdominale sont perméables et de calibre normal.
- Pas de dilatation des voies biliaires intra-hépatiques et du cholédoque. 
- La vésicule biliaire est de taille normale, de contenu transonore alithiasique, à paroi fine et régulière.    
- La rate est de taille normale mesurée à 84 à mm de grand axe. Son échostructure est homogène et ses contours réguliers. 
- Les reins sont de taille et d’échostructure normales sans dilatation des voies excrétrices ni image de lithiase objectivée. 
- Absence d’adénopathie profonde.
Etage pelvien : 
- L’utérus de taille augmentée, aux contours déformés mesurant 101x88x67 mm. Le myomètre est remanié par au moins 08 noyaux myomateux, dont le plus remarquable est de siège intra mural à développement sous muqueux corporéal postérieur mesurant 46 mm de grand axe. L’endomètre est normal.  
- L’ovaire droit est de taille augmentée mesurant 51x25 mm, avec la présence d’une formation ovalaire liquidienne aux contours nets et réguliers, à paroi fine, au contenu marqué des fines travées échogènes réalisant l’aspect en filet de pêche mesurant 33x28x26mm soit 13 ml de volume. 
- L’ovaire gauche est de taille normale mesurant 20x14 mm, d’échostructure normofolliculaire.
- La vessie est de contenu transonore alithiasique, à paroi fine et régulière. 
- Epanchement liquidien de minime abondance dans le cul-de-sac de Douglas.

Conclusion

Arguments ultrasonographiques d’une hépatomégalie homogène sans anomalie de la veine porte et des voies biliaires : à corréler à la biologie. 
Gros utérus non gravide, polymyomateux dont le noyau le plus remarquable est corporéal postérieur classé FIGO 2-5.
Kyste ovarien droit d’allure fonctionnelle hémorragique de 13 ml de volume.
Epanchement liquidien de minime abondance dans le Douglas : à corréler à la clinique puis à un PV si nécessaire.
Reste de l’examen sans particularité.
translation:
Indication: Functional colopathy + right ovarian cyst  
Technique: Examination performed using a 3.5 MHz transducer  

RESULTS:  
Abdominal region  
- The liver is enlarged, measuring 155 mm in height along the right renal axis, with regular contours and a homogeneous echotexture.  
- The portal vein and its branches, the inferior vena cava, and the abdominal aorta are patent and of normal caliber.  
- No dilation of the intrahepatic bile ducts or the common bile duct.  
- The gallbladder is of normal size, with an anechoic, non-lithiasic content, and has a thin, regular wall.  
- The spleen is of normal size, measuring 84 mm in its long axis. Its echotexture is homogeneous, and its contours are regular.  
- The kidneys are of normal size and echotexture, with no dilation of the excretory pathways or evidence of lithiasis.  
- No deep lymphadenopathy.  

Pelvic region:  
- The uterus is enlarged with deformed contours, measuring 101x88x67 mm. The myometrium is altered by at least 8 myomatous nodules, the most notable being intramural with submucosal development in the posterior body, measuring 46 mm in its long axis. The endometrium is normal.  
- The right ovary is enlarged, measuring 51x25 mm, with an oval liquid formation with clear and regular contours, a thin wall, and content marked by fine echogenic strands, resembling a fishnet, measuring 33x28x26 mm, or 13 ml in volume.  
- The left ovary is of normal size, measuring 20x14 mm, with a normal follicular echotexture.  
- The bladder has an anechoic, non-lithiasic content, with a thin, regular wall.  
- Minimal fluid accumulation in the pouch of Douglas.  

Conclusion  

Ultrasonographic evidence of homogeneous hepatomegaly without abnormalities of the portal vein and bile ducts: correlation with laboratory tests is recommended.  
Enlarged, non-pregnant, polymyomatous uterus, with the most notable nodule being posterior corporeal, classified as FIGO 2-5.  
Right ovarian cyst appearing functional and hemorrhagic, with a volume of 13 ml.  
Minimal fluid accumulation in the Douglas: correlation with clinical findings and possibly a pelvic ultrasound if necessary.  
The remainder of the examination is unremarkable.

report:
Douleur pelvienne avec test de grossesse positif.
Indication :  Technique : Réalisation de l’examen à l’aide d’un transducteur de 3.5 MHz
    
RESULTATS 
L’examen ultrasonographique réalisé par voie sus-pubienne objective ce jour :
Un utérus de taille normale mesurant :
91 mm de hauteur
54 mm de largeur
47 mm d’épaisseur 
Ses contours sont réguliers. 
Son échostructure est homogène.
L’endomètre est d’épaisseur et d’échostructure normales.
L’ovaire droit mesurant 38x20mm, siège d’un sac gestationnel contenant un embryon pulsatile de 48 mm de diamètre, correspondant à un terme gestationnel de 06 SA +1 jour. 
L’ovaire gauche est de taille normale 32x18mm, d’échostructure normofolliculaire.
La vessie est de capacité bonne, de contenu transsonore avec une paroi fine et régulière. 
Le cul-de-sac de Douglas est libre.
CONCLUSION

Arguments échographiques d’une GEU ovarienne droite non rompue de 06 SA + 1 jour : intérêt d’un avis obstétrical.
Utérus vide, non gravide et ovaire gauche normaux. 
Douglas libre.
translation:
Pelvic pain with a positive pregnancy test.

Indication: Technique: Examination performed using a 3.5 MHz transducer

RESULTS
The transabdominal ultrasound examination conducted today reveals:

A uterus of normal size measuring:
- 91 mm in height
- 54 mm in wiRXh
- 47 mm in thickness
Its contours are regular.
Its echotexture is homogeneous.
The endometrium is of normal thickness and echotexture.

The right ovary measures 38x20 mm and contains a gestational sac with a pulsating embryo measuring 48 mm in diameter, corresponding to a gestational age of 6 weeks and 1 day.

The left ovary is of normal size, 32x18 mm, with a normal follicular echotexture.

The bladder has good capacity, is anechoic, with a thin and regular wall.

The pouch of Douglas is clear.

CONCLUSION

Ultrasound findings suggest a right ovarian ectopic pregnancy, unruptured, at 6 weeks and 1 day: obstetric consultation recommended.
Empty, non-pregnant uterus and normal left ovary.
Clear Douglas pouch.

report:
Quesito diagnostico: “riscontro ecografico incidentale di lesione focale epatica”.
Dati tecnici: esame eseguito con tomografo ad alto campo (3T), con sequenze T2 TSE, SPIR, DUAL FFE, DWI, mDIXONquant, mDIXON prima e dopo somministrazione di mdc extracellulare ev (10 ml).
Referto
RM ADDOME SUPERIORE
Fegato di regolare morfovolumetria ad intensità di segnale alterata a focolaio per la presenza, in corrispondenza del VII segmento, di formazione ovalare a margini lobulati, dei diametri massimi di 4 x 3,8 cm, ipointensa nelle immagini T1-pesate e fortemente iperintensa in quelle T2-pesate. Dopo somministrazione di mdc la suddetta lesione presenta enhancement globulare periferica ad andamento centripeto con riempimento pressocché completo nella fase tardiva acquisita a 10 min; è pertanto da riferire ad angioma cavernoso.
Coesistono, in corrispondenza del VI segmento in sede sottocapsulare, altre tre formazioni ovalari del diametro massimo rispettivamente di 1,6 cm, 0,8 cm e 0,5 cm: la maggiore con le medesime caratteristiche intensitometriche; le due più piccole presentano omogeneo enhancement in fase arteriosa e risultano isointense ai vasi nelle successive fasi; sono pertanto da riferire ad angiomi capillari.
In sede attigua si apprezzano alcune aree ipervascolari evidenti nella sola fase arteriosa compatibili con aree di alterata perfusione.
Colecisti eumorfica, esente da difetti endoluminali d’intensità di segnale da riferire a litiasi. VBI e VBE non dilatate.
Vena porta ed affluenti portali pervi e di calibro regolare.
Non alterazioni di rilievo di milza, pancreas, surreni e reni (millimetrica cisti corticale a destra).
Assenza di linfonodi significativamente aumentati di volume.
Conclusioni: presenza di due lesioni focali epatiche compatibili con angiomi cavernosi (VII-VI segmento) e due lesioni focali compatibili con angiomi capillari (VI segmento).
translation:
Diagnostic query: "Incidental ultrasound finding of a focal liver lesion."

Technical data: Examination performed with a high-field (3T) MRI scanner, using T2 TSE, SPIR, DUAL FFE, DWI, mDIXONquant sequences, and mDIXON before and after intravenous administration of 10 ml of extracellular contrast agent.

Report
MRI UPPER ABDOMEN
The liver is of normal size and shape, with an altered signal intensity focus in the VII segment, where there is an oval formation with lobulated margins, measuring up to 4 x 3.8 cm. It appears hypointense on T1-weighted images and markedly hyperintense on T2-weighted images. After contrast administration, the lesion shows peripheral globular enhancement with a centripetal pattern, almost completely filling in the late phase acquired at 10 minutes, consistent with a cavernous hemangioma.

Additionally, in the VI segment, in a subcapsular location, there are three other oval formations with maximum diameters of 1.6 cm, 0.8 cm, and 0.5 cm, respectively. The largest has similar intensity characteristics; the two smaller ones show homogeneous enhancement in the arterial phase and are isointense with the vessels in subsequent phases, consistent with capillary hemangiomas.

Adjacent areas show some hypervascular regions visible only in the arterial phase, compatible with areas of altered perfusion.

The gallbladder is normal in shape, without endoluminal signal intensity defects suggestive of lithiasis. The intrahepatic and extrahepatic bile ducts are not dilated.

The portal vein and its tributaries are patent and of regular caliber.

No significant abnormalities in the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys (a small cortical cyst on the right).

No significantly enlarged lymph nodes.

Conclusions: Presence of two focal liver lesions compatible with cavernous hemangiomas (VII-VI segment) and two focal lesions compatible with capillary hemangiomas (VI segment).

report:
Quesito diagnostico: “elevati valori di PSA”.
Dati tecnici: esame eseguito con sequenze assiali, coronali e sagittali TSE T2 pesate, TSE T1 pesate,GRE e DWI (b800, b1400, b2500 sintetica) prima e dopo mdc ev paramagnetico (7 ml).
Referto 
Ghiandola prostatica nei limiti inferiori di norma (RX:4 cm; DAP: 3,5 cm; DL. 3,4 cm,volume 25 cc). 
Zona di transizione di ridotte dimensioni. 
Zona periferica diffusamente ipointensa. Si rileva area ipointensa in T2 del RX max di 3 x 1,7 cm, dotata di marcata restrizione in DWI ed ipointensità in ADC (PI-RADS score 5), in corrispondenza della zona periferica sinistra (dalla base all'apice) con interessamento anche della zona periferica destra. Tale area supera la capsula adiacente ed invade la vescichetta seminale sinistra, aumentata di dimensioni rispetto alla controlaterale (ESUR ECE score: 5). Vescica parzialmente repleta e, per quanto valutabile, esente da evidente contenuto patologico endoluminale. 
Non linfonodi significativamente aumentati di dimensioni. 
Non versamento libero nello scavo pelvico. 
Diverticolosi del sigma.
Conclusioni: area nella zona periferica sinistra con estensione alla zona periferica destra (PI-RADS score 5) che invade la vescichetta seminale omolaterale (ESUR ECE score: 5) di natura eteroplastica.
translation:
Diagnostic query: "elevated PSA levels."

Technical data: examination performed with axial, coronal, and sagittal TSE T2-weighted, TSE T1-weighted, GRE, and DWI (b800, b1400, synthetic b2500) sequences before and after intravenous administration of paramagnetic contrast (7 ml).

Report:
The prostate gland is at the lower limits of normal size (transverse diameter: 4 cm; anteroposterior diameter: 3.5 cm; longitudinal diameter: 3.4 cm; volume 25 cc). The transition zone is small. The peripheral zone is diffusely hypointense. There is a hypointense area on T2 with a maximum transverse diameter of 3 x 1.7 cm, showing marked restriction on DWI and hypointensity on ADC (PI-RADS score 5), located in the left peripheral zone (from base to apex) with involvement of the right peripheral zone as well. This area extends beyond the adjacent capsule and invades the left seminal vesicle, which is enlarged compared to the contralateral side (ESUR ECE score: 5). The bladder is partially filled and, as far as can be assessed, free from any evident pathological endoluminal content. No significantly enlarged lymph nodes. No free fluid in the pelvic cavity. Sigmoid diverticulosis.

Conclusions: Area in the left peripheral zone extending to the right peripheral zone (PI-RADS score 5) invading the ipsilateral seminal vesicle (ESUR ECE score: 5) of heteroplastic nature.

report: Klinik, Fragestellung, rechtfertigende Indikation: Dialysepflichtige Niereninsuffizienz. Erbitte Implantation eines getunnelten Dialysekatheters.  Methodik: Rückenlage. Sonographie des rechten Halses. Wischdesinfektion und sterile Abdeckung. Lokalanästhesie mit ca. 40 ml Xylonest 1%. Ultraschall-gesteuerte Punktion der V. jugularis interna dextra und Einlage einer Splittschleuse. Tunnelung des Dialysekatheters und Einführung über die Schleuse. Entfernung der Schleuse. Lagekontrolle des Katheters unter Durchleuchtung. Flusskontrolle beider Schenkel. Blockung beider Schenkel mit Citratlösung 4% (Citralock). Verband. Durchleuchtungszeit: 0,6 min Fluoro. 109,14 µGym2.  Befund: Rechts juguläre Einlage eines getunnelten Dialysekatheters (GlidePath Long-Term, 23 cm Länge Muffe-Katheterspitze).  Beurteilung: Technisch erfolgreiche und komplikationslose Anlage eines getunnelten Hämodialysekatheters. Projektion der Katheterspitze im rechten Vorhof.
translation:
Clinical Information, Question, Justification: Dialysis-dependent renal insufficiency. Request for implantation of a tunneled dialysis catheter. 

Method: Supine position. Ultrasound of the right neck. Skin disinfection and sterile draping. Local anesthesia with approximately 40 ml of Xylonest 1%. Ultrasound-guided puncture of the right internal jugular vein and insertion of a peel-away sheath. Tunneling of the dialysis catheter and introduction through the sheath. Removal of the sheath. Position check of the catheter under fluoroscopy. Flow check of both lumens. Locking of both lumens with 4% citrate solution (Citralock). Dressing applied. Fluoroscopy time: 0.6 min. Fluoro. 109.14 µGy/m².

Findings: Right jugular insertion of a tunneled dialysis catheter (GlidePath Long-Term, 23 cm length from hub to catheter tip).

Conclusion: Technically successful and complication-free placement of a tunneled hemodialysis catheter. Projection of the catheter tip in the right atrium.

report: Klinik, Fragestellung: Schmerzhafte Gonarthrose rechts. Immobilisierende Schmerzen. Symptomatische Behandlung mittels Gelenkarterien-Embolisation erwünscht. Individueller Heilversuch bei Ablehnung einer Knie-TEP und ausgeschöpfter konventioneller Therapie.  Methodik und Befund: Mehrere Voruntersuchungen, zuletzt 05.12.23. Rückenlagerung. Wischdesinfektion. Steriles Abdecken. Lokalanästhesie. Sonographisch gestützte, glatte antegrade Punktion der rechten AFC mittels Mikropunktionsset und Einlage einer 4 F-Schleuse (BriteTip). Sondierung der AFS rechts mittels 3.3F JR 1.0-Katheter (PediVascular). Übersichtsdarstellung mit DSA, hier zeigt sich ein leichter KM Blush an der medialen Femurkondyle. Jeweils selektive Sondierung der entsprechenden Geniculararterien mit Mikrodraht (0,014 Fathom) und Mikrokatheter (1,7F Echelon). Darstellung in DSA-Technik mit Nachweis eines KM-Blush, Vorsichtige superselektive, temporäre Partikelembolisation mittels kristallinem Imipenem/Cilastin-Gemisch (500 mg auf 10 ml Imeron-300). Abschlusskontrolle. Regelrechte 3-Gefäßversorgung des Unterschenkels. Materialentfernung. Manuelles Abdrücken. Druckverband. Intraarterielle Gabe von 2000 IE Heparin.   Beurteilung: Technisch erfolgreiche transarterielle, periartikuläre Embolisation des rechten Kniegelenks.
translation: Clinical Information, Question: Painful osteoarthritis of the right knee. Immobilizing pain. Symptomatic treatment via joint artery embolization desired. Individual treatment attempt due to refusal of knee replacement surgery and exhausted conventional therapy. Methodology and Findings: Multiple prior examinations, most recent on 12/05/23. Supine position. Skin disinfection. Sterile draping. Local anesthesia. Ultrasound-guided, smooth antegrade puncture of the right common femoral artery using a micropuncture set and placement of a 4F sheath (BriteTip). Catheterization of the right superficial femoral artery using a 3.3F JR 1.0 catheter (PediVascular). Overview imaging with DSA, showing a slight contrast medium blush at the medial femoral condyle. Selective catheterization of the corresponding genicular arteries with a microguidewire (0.014 Fathom) and microcatheter (1.7F Echelon). Imaging with DSA technique demonstrating contrast medium blush, cautious superselective, temporary particle embolization using a crystalline imipenem/cilastatin mixture (500 mg in 10 ml Imeron-300). Final check. Normal three-vessel supply to the lower leg. Removal of materials. Manual compression. Pressure bandage. Intra-arterial administration of 2000 IU heparin. Assessment: Technically successful transarterial, periarticular embolization of the right knee joint.

report: Klinik, Fragestellung, rechtfertigende Indikation: pAVK IV links. Bitte Darstellung des restlichen Beines.  Methodik und Befund: Rückenlage. Wischdesinfektion und sterile Abdeckung. Lokalanästhesie und Überprüfung der Wirksamkeit. Ultraschallgestützte retrograde arterielle Mikro-Punktion (Innenleben) der linken A. femoralis communis (Patch). Angiographien. Konstanter Verschluss der A. femoralis superficialis mit Wiederauffüllung 12 cm weiter distal über Kollateralen der kräftig kontrastierten A. femoralis profunda. Mittel- und hochgradige Stenosen der A. femoralis superficialis bis in die A. popolitea (in P1 und P2). Kräfitg kontratierte A. tibialis posterior bis in den Fuß (führendes arterielles Gefäß im Unterschenkel). Geringgradige Stenose der A. tibialis anterior. A. fibularis und tibialis anterior verdämmern im distalen Unterschenkel auf Höhe des Malleolus.  Beurteilung: •    Technisch erfolgreiche und komplikationslose angiografische Darstellung des linken Beins. •    Konstanter Verschluss der A. femoralis superficialis mit Wiederauffüllung 12 cm weiter distal über AFP-Kollateralen. •    Konstante, hochgradige Stenosen der A. femoralis superficialis und A. poplitea (in P1 und P2). Das P3-Segment ohne Nachweis signifikanter Stenosen. •    Kräftig kontrastierte (im Unterschenkel führende) A. tibialis posterior. A. fibularis und tibialis anterior verdämmern auf Höhe des Malleolus bei subtotalen Stenosen (DD Verschlüssen) ebenda.
translation:
Clinical Information, Question, Justification: Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) stage IV on the left. Please visualize the rest of the leg.

Method and Findings: Supine position. Skin disinfection and sterile draping. Local anesthesia and verification of its effectiveness. Ultrasound-guided retrograde arterial micro-puncture (inner lumen) of the left common femoral artery (patch). Angiographies. Persistent occlusion of the superficial femoral artery with reconstitution 12 cm distally via collaterals from the well-contrasted profunda femoris artery. Moderate to severe stenoses of the superficial femoral artery extending into the popliteal artery (in segments P1 and P2). Well-contrasted posterior tibial artery extending into the foot (primary arterial vessel in the lower leg). Mild stenosis of the anterior tibial artery. The fibular and anterior tibial arteries taper off in the distal lower leg at the level of the malleolus.

Assessment:
- Technically successful and complication-free angiographic visualization of the left leg.
- Persistent occlusion of the superficial femoral artery with reconstitution 12 cm distally via profunda femoris artery collaterals.
- Persistent, high-grade stenoses of the superficial femoral artery and popliteal artery (in segments P1 and P2). The P3 segment shows no significant stenoses.
- Well-contrasted posterior tibial artery (leading vessel in the lower leg). The fibular and anterior tibial arteries taper off at the level of the malleolus with subtotal stenoses (differential diagnosis: occlusions) at the same location.

report: Klinik, Fragestellung, rechtfertigende Indikation: Glioblastom WHO IV. Rezidiv / Progress? neue Läsionen?  Technik: MRT Kopf 1,5 T: Scout. T2 TSE fs axial, T2 Flash Hemo axial, DWI axial mit ADC-Mapping, T2 TIRM koronar dark-fluid, T1 Flash axial prä- und post-KM (8,5 ml Gadovist i.v.) mit Subtraktion, T1-MPRAGE sagittal mit Rekonstruktionen.  Befund: Vergleich mit den letzten MR-Voraufnahmen.  Im Verlauf Konstante Resektionshöhle links temporal in Kommunikation mit dem linken Seitenventrikel mit flächiger Marklagergliose links temporal bis parietal / okzipital. Im kurzfristigen Verlauf konstantes im längerfristigen Verlauf  regredientes noduläres KM-Enhancement im mediokaudalen Randbereich (Se16/Im77-84). Seit der MR VU  dort neu aufgetretenes, jetzt konstante punktförmige Schrankenstörung im Thalamus links (Se. 15 Img. 108). In der letzten MR VU neue aufgetreten und jetzt hierzu konstanten Darstellung einer flau KM-enhancenden Läsion im Balken links mit angrenzendem konstantem Ödem. Keine pathologische Diffusionsrestriktion. In der Hemosequenz keine pathologischen Suszeptibilitätsartefakte. Keine Mittellinienverlagerung oder Herniation. Basale Liquorzisternen inkl. Kleinhirnbrückenwinkel frei einsehbar. Kein akuter Liquorafstau. Unauffällige Darstellung der Hypophyse und Epiphyse. Orbitae beidseits regelrecht. Erhaltenes T2w-flow-void der größeren intrakraniellen Blutleiter. Z. n. osteoplastischer Kraniotomie links temporal mit Deckung im Niveau, übriges knöchernes Neurokranium unauffällig. Mastoidzellen und NNH belüftet.  Beurteilung: Im langfristigen Verlauf konstante Darstellung der nodulären Schrankenstörung im Randbereich der Resektionshöhle. Kurzfristig konstante Darstellung in den letzten VU neu aufgetretenen Läsionen links thalamisch und im Balken links. Keine neuen malignitätssuspekten Läsionen.
translation:
Clinical Information, Question, Justification: Glioblastoma WHO Grade IV. Recurrence/Progression? New lesions? 

Technique: MRI of the head at 1.5 T: Scout. Axial T2 TSE with fat saturation, Axial T2 Flash Hemo, Axial DWI with ADC mapping, Coronal T2 TIRM dark-fluid, Axial T1 Flash pre- and post-contrast (8.5 ml Gadovist i.v.) with subtraction, Sagittal T1-MPRAGE with reconstructions.

Findings: Comparison with previous MRI scans. Over time, there is a stable resection cavity in the left temporal region communicating with the left lateral ventricle, with extensive white matter gliosis extending from the left temporal to parietal/occipital regions. In the short term, there is stable, and in the long term, regressing nodular contrast enhancement at the mediocaudal margin (Se16/Im77-84). Since the last MRI, a newly appeared, now stable, pinpoint enhancement in the left thalamus (Se. 15 Img. 108). In the last MRI, a newly appeared and now stable faintly enhancing lesion in the left corpus callosum with adjacent stable edema. No pathological diffusion restriction. No pathological susceptibility artifacts in the hemo sequence. No midline shift or herniation. Basal cisterns, including the cerebellopontine angle, are clearly visible. No acute cerebrospinal fluid obstruction. Normal appearance of the pituitary and pineal glands. Orbits are normal on both sides. Preserved T2-weighted flow void of the major intracranial blood vessels. Status post osteoplastic craniotomy in the left temporal region with level coverage, the remaining bony neurocranium is unremarkable. Mastoid air cells and paranasal sinuses are aerated.

Conclusion: Over the long term, stable appearance of the nodular enhancement at the margin of the resection cavity. In the short term, stable appearance of newly appeared lesions in the left thalamus and left corpus callosum in the last examination. No new lesions suspicious for malignancy.

report: Klinik, Fragestellung, Rechtfertigende Indikation: Aderhautmelanom, pulmonal und zerebral metastasiert, Verlaufskontrolle.  Technik: 1,5-Tesla-MRT des Neurokraniums. Localizer. T2 FLAIR axial, T2 TSE axial, T1 SE axial und sagittal, DWI/ADC axial, SWI axial. Nach i.v. Applikation von 8 ml Gadovist T1 SE axial, T1-MPRAGE.  Befund: Es liegen Voraufnahmen zum Vergleich vor.  Weiter gering größenregrediente randständig schrankengestörte Raumforderung links temporal, aktuell bis 9 x 8 mm messend (Serie 15/63; VU: 12 x 8 mm). Allenfalls nur noch sehr flau abgrenzbare Metastase im medialen hinteren cerebellum (Serie 15/49; VU: 3 x 2 mm). Kein Nachweis einer neuen metastasensuspekten Raumforderung. Größenkonstantes frontales Falxmeningeom bis 30 mm Durchmesser (sehr 15/130). Von links frontal einliegende Ventrikeldrainage mit Spitze im linken Seitenventrikelvorderhorn. Unveränderte Asymmetrie der Seitenventrikel (rechts > links). Kein Liquoraufstau. Keine Mittellinienverlagerung. Keine Herniation. Flächiges Defektareal rechts frontotemporal. Unveränderte Gliosezone links frontal im Bereich des einliegenden Shunts. Keine Blutungs-suspekten Suszebiltätsartefakte. Keine für eine frische Ischämie suspekte Diffusionsrestriktion. Z. n. Hemikraniektomie rechts. Teilverlegte Mastoidzellen beidseits sowie basale Schleimhautschwellung im Sinus maxillaris beidseits. Weiter größenregrediente Weichteilmetastase an der Cutis am linken Mastikatorraum, aktuell bis 7 mm Durchmesser (Serie 15/730; VU: 11 x 8 mm).  Beurteilung: •    Weiter größenregrediente links temporomesiale Metastase sowie allenfalls noch fraglich abgrenzbare zerebelläre Metastase. Kein Nachweis neuer intrakranieller Metastasen. •    Miterfasst Größenregredienz der Weichteilmetastase angrenzend an den Mastikatorraum links. •    Größenkonstantes Falxmeningeom.
translation:
Clinical Information, Question, Justification: Choroidal melanoma with pulmonary and cerebral metastases, follow-up evaluation. 

Technique: 1.5-Tesla MRI of the brain. Localizer. Axial T2 FLAIR, axial T2 TSE, axial and sagittal T1 SE, axial DWI/ADC, axial SWI. Post-contrast administration of 8 ml Gadovist, axial T1 SE, T1-MPRAGE.

Findings: Previous images are available for comparison. There is a further slight reduction in size of the peripheral lesion with blood-brain barrier disruption in the left temporal region, currently measuring up to 9 x 8 mm (Series 15/63; previous: 12 x 8 mm). A cerebellar metastasis in the medial posterior region is now barely discernible (Series 15/49; previous: 3 x 2 mm). No evidence of new suspicious metastatic lesions. A stable-sized frontal falx meningioma measuring up to 30 mm in diameter (Series 15/130). A ventricular drain is present from the left frontal region, with the tip in the anterior horn of the left lateral ventricle. Unchanged asymmetry of the lateral ventricles (right > left). No cerebrospinal fluid accumulation. No midline shift. No herniation. A broad defect area in the right frontotemporal region. Unchanged gliosis zone in the left frontal region near the shunt. No susceptibility artifacts suggestive of bleeding. No diffusion restriction indicative of acute ischemia. Status post right hemicraniectomy. Partially opacified mastoid air cells on both sides and basal mucosal swelling in the maxillary sinuses on both sides. Further reduction in size of the soft tissue metastasis in the skin of the left masticator space, currently up to 7 mm in diameter (Series 15/730; previous: 11 x 8 mm).

Impression:
- Further reduction in size of the left temporomesial metastasis and a cerebellar metastasis that is now barely discernible. No evidence of new intracranial metastases.
- Noted reduction in size of the soft tissue metastasis adjacent to the left masticator space.
- Stable-sized falx meningioma.

T2 FLAIR axial, T2 TSE axial, T1 SE axial und sagittal, DWI/ADC axial, SWI axial. Nach i.v. Applikation von 8 ml Gadovist T1 SE axial, T1-MPRAGE.  Befund: Es liegen Voraufnahmen zum Vergleich vor.  Weiter gering größenregrediente randständig schrankengestörte Raumforderung links temporal, aktuell bis 9 x 8 mm messend (Serie 15/63; VU: 12 x 8 mm). Allenfalls nur noch sehr flau abgrenzbare Metastase im medialen hinteren cerebellum (Serie 15/49; VU: 3 x 2 mm). Kein Nachweis einer neuen metastasensuspekten Raumforderung. Größenkonstantes frontales Falxmeningeom bis 30 mm Durchmesser (sehr 15/130). Von links frontal einliegende Ventrikeldrainage mit Spitze im linken Seitenventrikelvorderhorn. Unveränderte Asymmetrie der Seitenventrikel (rechts > links). Kein Liquoraufstau. Keine Mittellinienverlagerung. Keine Herniation. Flächiges Defektareal rechts frontotemporal. Unveränderte Gliosezone links frontal im Bereich des einliegenden Shunts. Keine Blutungs-suspekten Suszebiltätsartefakte. Keine für eine frische Ischämie suspekte Diffusionsrestriktion. Z. n. Hemikraniektomie rechts. Teilverlegte Mastoidzellen beidseits sowie basale Schleimhautschwellung im Sinus maxillaris beidseits. Weiter größenregrediente Weichteilmetastase an der Cutis am linken Mastikatorraum, aktuell bis 7 mm Durchmesser (Serie 15/730; VU: 11 x 8 mm).  Beurteilung: •���Weiter größenregrediente rechts temporomesiale Metastase sowie allenfalls noch fraglich abgrenzbare zerebelläre Metastase. Kein Nachweis neuer intrakranieller Metastasen. •���Miterfasst Größenregredienz der Weichteilmetastase angrenzend an den Mastikatorraum links. •���Größenkonstantes Falxmeningeom.
translation_with_error:
Clinical Information, Question, Justification: Choroidal melanoma with pulmonary and cerebral metastases, follow-up evaluation. 

Technique: 1.5-Tesla MRI of the brain. Localizer. Axial T2 FLAIR, axial T2 TSE, axial and sagittal T1 SE, axial DWI/ADC, axial SWI. Post-contrast administration of 8 ml Gadovist, axial T1 SE, T1-MPRAGE.

Findings: Previous images are available for comparison. There is a further slight reduction in size of the peripheral lesion with blood-brain barrier disruption in the left temporal region, currently measuring up to 9 x 8 mm (Series 15/63; previous: 12 x 8 mm). A cerebellar metastasis in the medial posterior region is now barely discernible (Series 15/49; previous: 3 x 2 mm). No evidence of new suspicious metastatic lesions. A stable-sized frontal falx meningioma measuring up to 30 mm in diameter (Series 15/130). A ventricular drain is present from the left frontal region, with the tip in the anterior horn of the left lateral ventricle. Unchanged asymmetry of the lateral ventricles (right > left). No cerebrospinal fluid accumulation. No midline shift. No herniation. A broad defect area in the right frontotemporal region. Unchanged gliosis zone in the left frontal region near the shunt. No susceptibility artifacts suggestive of bleeding. No diffusion restriction indicative of acute ischemia. Status post right hemicraniectomy. Partially opacified mastoid air cells on both sides and basal mucosal swelling in the maxillary sinuses on both sides. Further reduction in size of the soft tissue metastasis in the skin of the left masticator space, currently up to 7 mm in diameter (Series 15/730; previous: 11 x 8 mm).

Impression:
- Further reduction in size of the right temporomesial metastasis and a cerebellar metastasis that is now barely discernible. No evidence of new intracranial metastases.
- Noted reduction in size of the soft tissue metastasis adjacent to the left masticator space.
- Stable-sized falx meningioma.

report: Esame eseguito con strategia 30 – 2 ZETA. 1° esame computerizzato. In OD il tracciato presenta lieve riduzione della sensibilità retinica in tutti i settori, eccetto che nel temporale inferiore. Le mappe della Total deviation e della Pattern deviation presentano diversi punti di anomalia. GHT oltre i limiti della norma. La macchia cieca è di dimensioni normali. Fovea 35 dB; MD -2.87 dB; PSD 3.71 dB. In OS il tracciato presenta una notevole riduzione della sensibilità retinica soprattutto nel settore temporale superiore e a seguire in quello inferiore, mantenendo un’area di visione residua soprattutto in un’area a cavallo dei settori temporali e oltre i 20°. La macchia cieca è inglobata in un’area scotomatosa che interessa gran parte del campo visivo. Le mappe della Total deviation e della Pattern deviation presentano grave alterazione corrispondente ai deficit su indicati. GHT oltre i limiti della norma. Fovea -1 dB; MD -23.32 dB; PSD 9.45 dB.Gli indici di attendibilità sono bassi in ambo gli occhi. Conclusioni: l'esame effettuato è compatibile con la presenza di glaucoma in stadio incipiente in OD, avanzato in OS.
translation: Exam performed using the 30 – 2 ZETA strategy. This is the first computerized test. In the right eye (OD), the trace shows a slight reduction in retinal sensitivity across all sectors, except for the lower temporal sector. The Total Deviation and Pattern Deviation maps show several points of abnormality. The Glaucoma Hemifield Test (GHT) is outside normal limits. The blind spot is of normal size. Fovea measures 35 dB; Mean Deviation (MD) is -2.87 dB; Pattern Standard Deviation (PSD) is 3.71 dB. In the left eye (OS), the trace shows a significant reduction in retinal sensitivity, particularly in the upper temporal sector, followed by the lower sector, with a residual area of vision mainly spanning the temporal sectors and beyond 20°. The blind spot is encompassed within a scotomatous area affecting a large portion of the visual field. The Total Deviation and Pattern Deviation maps show severe alterations corresponding to the aforementioned deficits. GHT is outside normal limits. Fovea measures -1 dB; MD is -23.32 dB; PSD is 9.45 dB. Reliability indices are low in both eyes. Conclusions: The exam results are consistent with the presence of early-stage glaucoma in the right eye and advanced-stage glaucoma in the left eye.

report: Esame eseguito con strategia 30 – 2 – ZETA. 1° esame computerizzato. In OD emianopsia destra associata a quadranopsia nasale inferiore nettamente delimitata rispetto al piano orizzontale e al settore nasale superiore con risparmio dell’area centrale in tutti i settori. Fovea 31 dB; MD - 21.28 dB; PSD 13.23 dB.La macchia cieca è inglobata nell’emianopsia temporale. In OS campo visivo assente in tutti i settori. Gli indici di attendibilità dell’esame sono accettabili. Conclusioni: Lesione chiasmatica anteriore e pre-chiasmatica interessante anche il nervo ottico dell’OS e parte di quello dell’OD. Si consiglia di effettuare RM dell’encefalo e dell’ipofisi con mezzo di contrasto.
translation: Exam performed using the 30 – 2 – ZETA strategy. First computerized exam. In the right eye (OD), there is right hemianopia associated with a clearly defined lower nasal quadrantanopia relative to the horizontal plane and the upper nasal sector, with sparing of the central area in all sectors. Fovea 31 dB; MD -21.28 dB; PSD 13.23 dB. The blind spot is encompassed within the temporal hemianopia. In the left eye (OS), the visual field is absent in all sectors. The reliability indices of the exam are acceptable. Conclusions: Anterior chiasmal and pre-chiasmal lesion affecting the optic nerve of the left eye (OS) and part of the right eye (OD). A brain and pituitary MRI with contrast is recommended.

report: Esame eseguito con strategia 30 – 2 – ZETA. 2° esame computerizzato. In OD la sensibilità retinica risulta ampiamente ridotta soprattutto nella fascia a cavallo dei settori superiori ed inferiori, sia temporali che nasali, a partenza dalla macchia cieca che risulta inglobata nell'ampio scotoma centrale (scotoma superiore di Bjerrum).Fovea -1 dB; MD -10.97 dB; PSD 11.22 dB. La mappa della Total deviation e quella della Pattern deviation presentano profonda alterazione della sensibilità retinica nei settori superiori, mentre è in parte recuperata la sensibilità nei settori inferiori, rispetto all'esame precedente. GHT oltre i limiti della norma. In OS la sensibilità retinica risulta complessivamente nei limiti della norma pur presentandosi delle piccole aree di riduzione in periferia, oltre i 20°, nel settore nasale superiore ed in quello temporale inferiore. La macchia cieca è di dimensioni normali. Fovea 37 dB; MD 1.61 dB; PSD 2.96 dB La mappa della Total deviation è normale, mentre quella della Pattern deviation presenta alcuni punti di riduzione della sensibilità nei settori inferiori. GHT entro i limiti della norma. Gli indici di attendibilità dell’esame sono scarsi in OO. Conclusioni: Il tracciato presenta ampia alterazione della sensibilità retinica in OD ed una condizione ai limiti della norma in OS.
translation: Exam performed using the 30 – 2 – ZETA strategy. This is the second computerized test. In the right eye (OD), retinal sensitivity is significantly reduced, particularly across the upper and lower sectors, both temporal and nasal, starting from the blind spot, which is encompassed within the large central scotoma (superior Bjerrum scotoma). Fovea -1 dB; MD -10.97 dB; PSD 11.22 dB. The Total Deviation and Pattern Deviation maps show a profound reduction in retinal sensitivity in the upper sectors, while there is partial recovery of sensitivity in the lower sectors compared to the previous exam. GHT is beyond normal limits. In the left eye (OS), retinal sensitivity is generally within normal limits, although there are small areas of reduction in the periphery, beyond 20°, in the upper nasal and lower temporal sectors. The blind spot is of normal size. Fovea 37 dB; MD 1.61 dB; PSD 2.96 dB. The Total Deviation map is normal, while the Pattern Deviation map shows some points of reduced sensitivity in the lower sectors. GHT is within normal limits. The reliability indices of the exam are poor in both eyes (OO). Conclusions: The trace shows a significant alteration in retinal sensitivity in the right eye and a condition at the limits of normal in the left eye.

report: L’esame effettuato mediante scansioni lineari radiali passanti per la fovea (Radial) e ricostruzione in 3D (Retina Map) ha evidenziato: In OD presenza di pucker maculare che si mostra nelle scansioni esaminate come una linea ipereflettente lungo il profilo interno della retina associato a fenomeni di trazione sulla retina e la formazione di foro maculare stadio 1-2 con presenza di evidente pseudocisti foveale. Lieve edema degli strati interni. Evidenziabili i diversi strati della retina ed in particolare la MLE e l’ellissoide, che presenta una interruzione superiormente alla fovea in corrispondenza di una piccola area con dispersione di pigmento. Altra area di dispersione di pigmento è posta nasalmente alla fovea stessa. Assenza di fluidi anomali. Lo spessore retinico dell'area foveale risulta moderatamente aumentato in fovea (OD pari a 331μ). Il volume del cubo esaminato è pari a 10,3 mm3. Conclusioni: Pucker maculare in OD associato a foro maculare stadio 1-2. Dispersione di pigmento in alcune aree maculari. In OS esame nell’ambito della norma.
translation: The examination conducted using radial linear scans through the fovea (Radial) and 3D reconstruction (Retina Map) revealed: In the right eye (OD), the presence of a macular pucker, which appears in the examined scans as a hyper-reflective line along the inner profile of the retina, associated with traction phenomena on the retina and the formation of a stage 1-2 macular hole with an evident foveal pseudocyst. There is mild edema of the inner layers. The different layers of the retina are distinguishable, particularly the external limiting membrane (ELM) and the ellipsoid zone, which shows a disruption above the fovea corresponding to a small area with pigment dispersion. Another area of pigment dispersion is located nasally to the fovea itself. No abnormal fluids are present. The retinal thickness in the foveal area is moderately increased at the fovea (OD measuring 331μ). The volume of the examined cube is 10.3 mm3. Conclusions: Macular pucker in the right eye (OD) associated with a stage 1-2 macular hole. Pigment dispersion in some macular areas. Examination of the left eye (OS) is within normal limits.

report: L’esame effettuato mediante scansioni lineari parallele (High Definition Images 5 Line Raster ) passanti per l’area maculare e ricostruzione in 3D (Macular Cube 512x128), ha evidenziato: In OD presenza di punti di bassa reflettività pre-retinici indice di disomogeneità del vitreo e di una zona pre-retinica otticamente vuota dovuta a retrazione del vitreo (vitreoschisi). Il profilo interno della retina presenta la fisiologica depressione foveale ed appare regolare tranne che in un’area extramaculare corrispondente al fascio papillo-maculare dove è presente una convessità dovuta a distacco sieroso del neuroepitelio (CSCR). Ben evidenziabili i diversi strati della retina ed in particolare la MLE e la giunzione segmento interno/segmento esterno dei fotorecettori. Lo strato EPR-coriocapillare è di aspetto e reflettività normali. Spessore medio del campo centrale = 269 µ, volume del cubo esaminato = 11,2 mm3. In OS punti di bassa reflettività pre-retinici indice di disomogeneità del vitreo e di una zona pre-retinica otticamente vuota dovuta a retrazione del vitreo (vitreoschisi). Il profilo interno della retina, pur mostrando la fisiologica depressione foveale, presenta una marcata convessità conseguenza dell’ampio distacco sieroso del neuroepitelio (CSCR) che impegna la macula ed un’ampia area temporalmente ad essa. In corrispondenza delle stesse aree si nota edema intraretinico diffuso interessante tutti gli strati retinici. Ben evidenziabili i diversi strati della retina ed in particolare la MLE e la giunzione segmento interno/segmento esterno dei fotorecettori (o ellissoide). Spessore medio del campo centrale = 493 µ, volume del cubo esaminato = 14,3 mm3. Conclusioni: in OD corioretinopatia sierosa extramaculare. In OS corioretinopatiasierosa centrale (CSCR) di ampie proporzioni.
translation:
The examination conducted using parallel linear scans (High Definition Images 5 Line Raster) through the macular area and 3D reconstruction (Macular Cube 512x128) revealed the following:

In the right eye (OD), there are areas of low reflectivity in the pre-retinal space, indicating vitreous heterogeneity and an optically empty pre-retinal zone due to vitreous retraction (vitreoschisis). The internal retinal profile shows the physiological foveal depression and appears regular except in an extramacular area corresponding to the papillomacular bundle, where there is a convexity due to serous detachment of the neuroepithelium (CSCR). The various retinal layers are well-defined, particularly the external limiting membrane (ELM) and the inner segment/outer segment junction of the photoreceptors. The RPE-choriocapillaris layer appears normal in aspect and reflectivity. The average central field thickness is 269 µm, and the volume of the examined cube is 11.2 mm³.

In the left eye (OS), there are areas of low reflectivity in the pre-retinal space, indicating vitreous heterogeneity and an optically empty pre-retinal zone due to vitreous retraction (vitreoschisis). The internal retinal profile, while showing the physiological foveal depression, presents a marked convexity as a result of a large serous detachment of the neuroepithelium (CSCR) involving the macula and a large temporal area adjacent to it. In these same areas, there is diffuse intraretinal edema affecting all retinal layers. The various retinal layers are well-defined, particularly the ELM and the inner segment/outer segment junction of the photoreceptors (or ellipsoid). The average central field thickness is 493 µm, and the volume of the examined cube is 14.3 mm³.

Conclusions: In the right eye (OD), there is extramacular serous chorioretinopathy. In the left eye (OS), there is a large central serous chorioretinopathy (CSCR).

report: OD: Al polo posteriore, sono presenti aree iperfluorescenti che aumentano di intensità e dimensioni nel tempo. L’esame ICG e OCTA evidenziano una neovascolarizzazione sottoretinica. L’esame OCTmostra segni di attività della neovascolarizzazione sottoretinica. OS: Assenza di anomalie angiografiche al polo posteriore. L’esame OCTmostra conservato profilo e spessore maculare. L’esame OCTRNFL mostra lieve riduzione dello spessore dello strato delle fibre nervose nel quadrante temporale inferiore in OD e appare nella norma in OS. Conclusioni: OD: neovascolarizzazione sottoretinica attiva. Si consiglia iniezione intravitreale di anti-VEGF in OD.
translation: Right Eye (OD): In the posterior pole, there are hyperfluorescent areas that increase in intensity and size over time. The ICG and OCTA exams reveal subretinal neovascularization. The OCTexam shows signs of activity in the subretinal neovascularization. Left Eye (OS): No angiographic abnormalities are present in the posterior pole. The OCTexam shows a preserved macular profile and thickness. The OCTRNFL exam shows a slight reduction in the thickness of the nerve fiber layer in the lower temporal quadrant of the right eye (OD) and appears normal in the left eye (OS). Conclusions: Right Eye (OD): Active subretinal neovascularization. An intravitreal injection of anti-VEGF is recommended for the right eye (OD).

report: OO: Strie angioidi. OD: In regione maculare sono presenti aree irregolari ipo-iperfluorescenti che non aumentano di intensita’ nel tempo per alterazione dell’epitelio pigmentato retinico. L’esame ICG mostra numerose aree ipofluorescenti al polo posteriore con aspetto a “peau  d’orange” ed al polo posteriore nel settore temporale è presente un’area ipocianescente che non si modifica nel tempo da nevo della coroide, confermato anche da scansioni OCT. L’esame OCTevidenzia piccola falda di fluido sottoretinico sottoretinico in regione subfoveale. OS: In regione maculare sono presenti aree irregolari ipo-iperfluorescente che non aumentano di intensita’ nel tempo per alterazione dell’epitelio pigmentato retinico. L’esame ICG mostra numerose aree ipofluorescenti al polo posteriore con aspetto a “peau  d’orange”  ed evidenzia una neovascolarizzazione sottoretinica. L’esame OCTmostra una piccola falda di fluido sottoretinico sottoretinico in regione subfoveale. Conclusioni: Strie angioidi complicate in OO da neovascolarizzazione sottoretinica attiva. Si consiglia iniezione intravitreale di ANTI-VEGF in OO.
translation: Both Eyes: Angioid streaks. Right Eye: In the macular region, there are irregular hypo-hyperfluorescent areas that do not increase in intensity over time due to alterations in the retinal pigment epithelium. The ICG exam shows numerous hypofluorescent areas in the posterior pole with a "peau d'orange" appearance, and in the temporal sector of the posterior pole, there is a hypocyanscent area that remains unchanged over time, consistent with a choroidal nevus, also confirmed by OCTscans. The OCTexam reveals a small pocket of subretinal fluid in the subfoveal region. Left Eye: In the macular region, there are irregular hypo-hyperfluorescent areas that do not increase in intensity over time due to alterations in the retinal pigment epithelium. The ICG exam shows numerous hypofluorescent areas in the posterior pole with a "peau d'orange" appearance and highlights subretinal neovascularization. The OCTexam shows a small pocket of subretinal fluid in the subfoveal region. Conclusions: Angioid streaks complicated in both eyes by active subretinal neovascularization. Intravitreal injection of ANTI-VEGF is recommended in both eyes.

report: OD: Esame angiografico nella norma. L’esame OCTevidenzia profilo e spessore retinico nella norma. OS: Inferiormente all’arcata vascolare temporale inferiore si evidenzia un’area ipo-iperfuorescente che non si modifica nel tempo da esiti di melanoma della coroide trattato con brachiterapia. Si evidenzia occlusione di branca venosa, ramo di II ordine della vena temporale inferiore. Presenza di estese aree di non perfusione retinica nel settore inferiore. Lieve Aumento della permeabilità vasale al polo posteriore. L’esame OCTevidenzia conservato profilo foveolare con rare cisti intraretiniche e sollevamento dell’epitelio pigmentato retinico e della coriocapillare con ombreggiamento degli strati sottostanti in corrispondenza della lesione tumorale. Conclusioni: OS: Retinopatia da radiazione in esiti di melanoma della coroide trattato con brachiterapia. Si consiglia trattamento laser retinico in OS
translation: OD: The angiographic examination is normal. The OCTscan shows a normal retinal profile and thickness. OS: Below the inferior temporal vascular arcade, there is an area of hypo-hyperfluorescence that remains unchanged over time, consistent with the aftermath of choroidal melanoma treated with brachytherapy. There is an occlusion of a branch vein, a second-order branch of the inferior temporal vein. Extensive areas of retinal non-perfusion are present in the inferior sector. There is a slight increase in vascular permeability at the posterior pole. The OCTscan shows a preserved foveal profile with rare intraretinal cysts and elevation of the retinal pigment epithelium and choriocapillaris with shadowing of the underlying layers corresponding to the tumor lesion. Conclusions: OS: Radiation retinopathy as a result of choroidal melanoma treated with brachytherapy. Retinal laser treatment is recommended for OS.

report:
Befund:
 
 
Herz nicht vergrößert und unauffällig konfiguriert. Keine Mediastinalverbreiterung. Hili frei.
Unauffällige zentrale und periphere Lungengefäßzeichnung. Keine Flüssigkeitseinlagerungen.
Kleiner Pleuraerguss links, kein Erguss rechts. Kein Nachweis eines Pneumothorax. Kein Mediastinalshift.
Keine floriden Infiltrate oder raumfordernden Prozesse. Keine (post-)spezifischen Veränderungen.
Knöcherner Thorax ohne pathologischen Befund.
Weichteilmantel unauffällig.
 
Beurteilung:
Dezenter Randwinkelerguss rechts
translation:
Findings:

The heart is not enlarged and has a normal configuration. No widening of the mediastinum. Hila are clear. 
Normal appearance of central and peripheral pulmonary vasculature. No fluid accumulation. 
Small pleural effusion on the left, no effusion on the right. No evidence of pneumothorax. No mediastinal shift. 
No active infiltrates or space-occupying lesions. No (post-)specific changes. 
Bony thorax shows no pathological findings. 
Soft tissue envelope is unremarkable.

Impression:

Subtle costophrenic angle effusion on the right.

Prominenter a.e. entzündlicher  Lymphknoten rechts inguinal.
translation:
Findings:
No evidence of pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the cervical, supra- and infraclavicular, axillary, and retroperitoneal regions. A lymph node measuring approximately 2 x 0.5 cm is noted in the right inguinal area, with tenderness and centrally accentuated vascularization.

Conclusion:
Prominent lymph node in the right inguinal region, likely inflammatory in nature.

report: Indicazione all'esame: Paziente con neoformazione addominale.Esame eseguito prima e dopo somministrazione ev di mdc (Prohance, 14 ml) e confrontato con precedente TC. Fegato nei limiti volumetrici, non evidenti lesioni focali sospette nel suo contesto. Tuttora apprezzabili alcune formazioni cistiche, la maggiore di circa 10 mm al S4. Pervia la vena porta. Non dilatate le vie biliari. Colecisti poco espansa, con nota adenomiomatosi del fondo. Pancreas nei limiti per morfo-volumetria ed intensità di segnale. Non dilatato il dotto pancreatico principale. Come di norma la milza ed i surreni. Reni in sede, nei limiti morfo-volumetrici. Formazione cistica di circa 5 mm al III inferiore del rene di destra. Non dilatate le cavità escretrici calico-pieliche, bilateralmente. Non significatie linfoadenomegalie retroperitoneali. Tuttora apprezzabile la nota formazione espansiva di circa 76 x 65 x 60 mm, disomogeneamente vascolarizzata, in sede mesogastrica paramediana destra, essa appare strattamente adesa alla II - III porzione duodenale e circonda anteriormente, lateralmente e medialmente la VCI che appare compressa. Non sicuri piani di clivaggio con tali strutture. Non versamento libero nei recessi peritoneali dell'addome superiore. Conclusioni: nota formazione espansiva in sede mesogastrica paramediana destra, di non univoca interpretazione (GIST? formazione retroperitoneale?). Si rimanda a valutazione specialistica chirurgica e a tipizzazione istologica
translation: Indication for the exam: Patient with an abdominal mass. The exam was performed before and after intravenous administration of contrast medium (Prohance, 14 ml) and compared with a previous CT scan. The liver is within normal volume limits, with no suspicious focal lesions observed. Some cystic formations are still appreciable, the largest being approximately 10 mm in segment 4. The portal vein is patent. The bile ducts are not dilated. The gallbladder is slightly distended, with noted adenomyomatosis of the fundus. The pancreas is within normal limits for size and signal intensity. The main pancreatic duct is not dilated. The spleen and adrenal glands are normal. The kidneys are in place and within normal size limits. A cystic formation of about 5 mm is present in the lower third of the right kidney. The calyceal-pelvic excretory cavities are not dilated bilaterally. No significant retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. The previously noted expansive formation, approximately 76 x 65 x 60 mm, is still appreciable in the right paramedian mesogastric region. It is heterogeneously vascularized and appears tightly adherent to the second and third portions of the duodenum, surrounding the inferior vena cava anteriorly, laterally, and medially, which appears compressed. There are no clear cleavage planes with these structures. No free fluid is present in the peritoneal recesses of the upper abdomen. Conclusions: Noted expansive formation in the right paramedian mesogastric region, with an ambiguous interpretation (GIST? retroperitoneal formation?). Referral for surgical specialist evaluation and histological typing is recommended.

report:
RM CUORE SENZA E CON MDC EV
Esame eseguito con paziente a riposo, utilizzando sequenze Cine b-SSFP secondo piani paralleli ai principali assi cardiaci, sequenze STIR, sequenze MDE acquisite dopo iniezione e.v. di mdc Gadovist, dose 0.1 mmol/Kg. Biometria: altezza: 172 cm; peso: 100.5 kg; superficie corporea/BSA: 2.19 m^2 (sec. Mosteller).
Quesito diagnostico: approfondimento in paziente con IMA (2012) trattata con CABG ed insufficienza cardiaca cronica a FE ridotta.
Ventricolo sinistro: aspetto dilatato e pseudo-aneurismatico dei segmenti medio-apicali, con assottigliamento della parete miocardica a sede apicale. Moderata riduzione della funzione sistolica globale a riposo (FE: 37%) con discinesia dell'apice in toto ed ipo-acinesia dei segmenti anteriore e settali, in sede medio-ventricolare ed apicale e laterale in sede
 basale e medio-ventricolare. Lieve ipertrofia del SIV (14 mm).
Atrio sinistro: di dimensioni cavitarie lievemente aumentate, con insufficienza mitralica di grado lieve (+/++++).
Ventricolo destro: di dimensioni cavitarie nella norma, con conservati spessori parietali, con moderata riduzione della funzione sistolica globale a riposo.
Atrio destro: di dimensioni lievemente aumentate, con insufficienza tricuspidalica di grado lieve (+/++++).
Nelle sequenze STIR non si apprezzano aree di alterato segnale intra-miocardico. Si evidenziano fenomeni di stasi ematica in sede apicale endo-cavitaria.
Studio post-contrastrografico: Si apprezzano estese aree confluenti di impregnazione tardiva di mezzo di contrasto, a carico dei segmenti discinetici ed ipo-acinetici sovra-descritti, con prevalente pattern di distribuzione sub-endocardico;analoghe aree si apprezzano a carico dei muscoli papillari.
Conclusioni: Ventricolo sinistro dilatato, con aspetto pseudo-aneurismatico e con riduzione della funzione sistolica globale a riposo (FE: 37%); discinesia dell'apice in toto ed ipo-acinesia dei segmenti anteriore e settali, a sede medio ventricolare ed apicale e del segmento laterale, in sede basale e medio-ventricolare. Agli stessi livelli si apprezzano estese aree di necrosi miocardica, con prevalente pattern di distribuzione sub-endocardica a livello dei segmenti miocardici discinetici ed ipo-acinetici sovradescritti, oltre che in corrispondenza dei muscoli papillari.
translation:
CARDIAC MRI WITH AND WITHOUT CONTRAST

The examination was performed with the patient at rest, using Cine b-SSFP sequences aligned with the main cardiac axes, STIR sequences, and MDE sequences acquired after intravenous injection of Gadovist contrast agent, at a dose of 0.1 mmol/kg. Biometric data: height: 172 cm; weight: 100.5 kg; body surface area/BSA: 2.19 m² (according to Mosteller).

Clinical question: Further evaluation in a patient with a history of myocardial infarction (2012) treated with CABG and chronic heart failure with reduced ejection fraction.

Left Ventricle: Dilated and pseudo-aneurysmal appearance of the mid-apical segments, with thinning of the myocardial wall at the apex. Moderate reduction in global systolic function at rest (EF: 37%) with dyskinesia of the entire apex and hypo-akinesia of the anterior and septal segments at the mid-ventricular and apical levels, and lateral segment at the basal and mid-ventricular levels. Mild hypertrophy of the interventricular septum (14 mm).

Left Atrium: Slightly enlarged chamber dimensions, with mild mitral regurgitation (+/++++).

Right Ventricle: Normal chamber dimensions, with preserved wall thickness, and moderate reduction in global systolic function at rest.

Right Atrium: Slightly enlarged dimensions, with mild tricuspid regurgitation (+/++++).

STIR sequences do not reveal areas of altered intra-myocardial signal. Blood stasis phenomena are noted in the endo-cavitary apical region.

Post-contrast study: Extensive confluent areas of late contrast enhancement are observed in the dyskinetic and hypo-akinetic segments described above, predominantly with a sub-endocardial distribution pattern; similar areas are noted in the papillary muscles.

Conclusions: Dilated left ventricle with a pseudo-aneurysmal appearance and reduced global systolic function at rest (EF: 37%); dyskinesia of the entire apex and hypo-akinesia of the anterior and septal segments at the mid-ventricular and apical levels, and the lateral segment at the basal and mid-ventricular levels. Extensive areas of myocardial necrosis are noted at the same levels, predominantly with a sub-endocardial distribution pattern in the dyskinetic and hypo-akinetic myocardial segments described above, as well as in the papillary muscles.

report:
RM CUORE SENZA E CON MDC
Esame eseguito con paziente a riposo, utilizzando sequenze Cine b-SSFP secondo piani paralleli ai principali assi cardiaci, sequenze STIR, sequenze PSIR acquisite dopo iniezione e.v. di mdc Gadovist (0.1 mmol/Kg). 
Quesito diagnostico: approfondimento in paziente affetta da eteroplasia neuroendocrina, in trattamento con analogo della somatostatina e con recente insorgenza di extra-sistoli sopra-ventricolari.
Ventricolo sinistro: di dimensioni endo-cavitarie nella norma, con diametro massimo tele-diastolico pari a 48 mm e con conservata funzione sistolica in condizioni di riposo (valori globali di frazione d'eiezione pari a 60%). La massa miocardica normalizzata per peso e altezza è risultata pari a 56 g/m. Spessore massimo del setto IV: 12 mm. Aspetto lievemente iper-trabecolato della parete libera a sede antero-apicale del ventricolo sinistro.
Atrio sinistro: di dimensioni normali ed in assenza di insufficienza mitralica.
Ventricolo destro: di dimensioni cavitarie nella norma, con conservata funzione sistolica globale, in condizioni di riposo. Non evidenza di irregolarità e/o dilatazioni aneurismatiche in corrispondenza della parete libera.
Atrio destro: di dimensioni modicamente aumentate, con lieve insufficienza tricuspidalica.
Sequenze STIR e studio post-contrastografico: assenza di aree ascrivibili ad infiammazione miocardica in atto e/o pregressa e non evidenza di aree di fibrosi/necrosi miocardica ai vari livelli.
Conclusioni: ventricolo sinistro di dimensioni e volumetria conservate, con normale funzione sistolica globale a riposo (60%), in assenza di aree di infiammazione/necrosi e/o fibrosi miocardica ai vari livelli. Aspetto lievemente ipertrabecolato della parete libera, a sede antero-apicale del ventricolo sinistro. E' presente una modesta falda fluida pericardica, in prossimità della parete infero-laterale.
translation:
CARDIAC MRI WITHOUT AND WITH CONTRAST

The examination was performed with the patient at rest, using Cine b-SSFP sequences aligned with the main cardiac axes, STIR sequences, and PSIR sequences acquired after intravenous injection of Gadovist contrast agent (0.1 mmol/Kg).

Diagnostic query: further investigation in a patient with neuroendocrine heteroplasia, undergoing treatment with a somatostatin analog, and with recent onset of supraventricular extrasystoles.

Left Ventricle: normal endocavitary dimensions, with a maximum end-diastolic diameter of 48 mm and preserved systolic function at rest (global ejection fraction values of 60%). The myocardial mass normalized for weight and height is 56 g/m. Maximum thickness of the interventricular septum: 12 mm. The free wall at the antero-apical region of the left ventricle appears slightly hyper-trabeculated.

Left Atrium: normal dimensions with no mitral insufficiency.

Right Ventricle: normal chamber dimensions, with preserved global systolic function at rest. No evidence of irregularities and/or aneurysmal dilations in the free wall.

Right Atrium: moderately increased dimensions, with mild tricuspid insufficiency.

STIR sequences and post-contrast study: no areas attributable to active or previous myocardial inflammation and no evidence of myocardial fibrosis/necrosis at various levels.

Conclusions: left ventricle with preserved dimensions and volume, normal global systolic function at rest (60%), with no areas of inflammation/necrosis and/or myocardial fibrosis at various levels. Slightly hyper-trabeculated appearance of the free wall at the antero-apical region of the left ventricle. A modest pericardial fluid layer is present near the inferolateral wall.

Biometria: altezza: 164 cm; peso: 88 kg; superficie corporea/BSA: 2 m^2 (sec. Mosteller). Quesito diagnostico: approfondimento in paziente con pregressa SCA, trattata con PTCA su IVA prossimale e circonflessa (2016). NSTEMI (2017).
Ventricolo sinistro: di dimensioni cavitarie nella norma e conservati spessori parietali. Lievemente ridotta la funzione sistolica globale a riposo (FE: 47%), con ipocinesia della parete laterale, a sede medio-basale.

Conclusioni: ventricolo sinistro di dimensioni cavitarie e spessori nella norma, con lieve riduzione della funzione sistolica globale a riposo (FE: 47%) ed ipocinesia della parete laterale, a sede basale e medio-ventricolare.
translation:
CARDIAC MRI WITH AND WITHOUT CONTRAST

The examination was performed with the patient at rest, using Cine b-SSFP sequences aligned with the main cardiac axes, STIR sequences, and MDE sequences acquired after intravenous injection of Gadovist contrast agent at a dose of 0.1 mmol/kg. Biometric data: height: 164 cm; weight: 88 kg; body surface area/BSA: 2 m^2 (according to Mosteller). Diagnostic query: further evaluation in a patient with a history of ACS, treated with PTCA on the proximal LAD and circumflex artery (2016). NSTEMI (2017).

Left Ventricle: Normal chamber size and preserved wall thickness. Mildly reduced global systolic function at rest (EF: 47%), with hypokinesia of the lateral wall at the mid-basal level.

Left Atrium: Moderately increased in size, with mild mitral regurgitation (+/++++).

Right Ventricle: Normal chamber size, preserved wall thickness, with preserved global and segmental systolic function at rest (EF: 59%).

Right Atrium: Moderately increased in size, with mild tricuspid regurgitation.

STIR sequences show no areas of altered intra-myocardial signal.

Post-contrast study: A perfusion defect is noted, corresponding to an area of late contrast enhancement, affecting the lateral wall of the LV at the basal and mid-ventricular levels, with a sub-endocardial distribution pattern, indicative of post-ischemic necrosis.

Conclusions: Left ventricle with normal chamber size and wall thickness, with mild reduction in global systolic function at rest (EF: 47%) and hypokinesia of the lateral wall at the basal and mid-ventricular levels.

Post-contrast study: A perfusion defect is noted, corresponding to an area of late contrast enhancement, affecting the lateral wall of the LV at the basal and mid-ventricular levels, with a sub-endocardial distribution pattern, indicative of post-ischemic necrosis.

Conclusions: Right ventricle with normal chamber size and wall thickness, with mild reduction in global systolic function at rest (EF: 47%) and hypokinesia of the lateral wall at the basal and mid-ventricular levels.
---

report:
RM CUORE SENZA E CON MDC EV
Esame eseguito con paziente a riposo utilizzando sequenze cine e morfologiche secondo piani paralleli ai principali assi cardiaci, sequenze STIR + sequenze PSIR acquisite dopo iniezione endovena di mdc in paziente con recente dolore toracico oppressivo, con aumento della troponina e sospetta miocardite.
Ventricolo sinistro: di dimensioni endo-cavitarie nella norma, con diametro tele-diastolico pari a 48 mm; conservata funzione sistolica in condizioni di riposo con valori globali pari a 64%.
Atrio sinistro: dimensioni nella norma, in assenza di insufficienza mitralica.
Ventricolo destro: morfo-volumetricamente nella norma con conservata funzione sistolica globale a riposo.
Atrio destro: dimensioni modicamente aumentate, con lieve insufficienza tricuspidalica.
Sequenze STIR: area di infiammazione ed edema si apprezza a livello miocardico, in corrispondenza della parete laterale del VS a sede basale e medio-ventricolare, a distribuzione segmentaria epicardica e sub-epicardica.
Sequenze post-contrastografiche: sfumata area di lieve impregnazione si apprezza in corrispondenza della parete laterale del VS a sede basale e medio-ventricolare.
Conclusioni: conservata funzione sistolica globale ventricolare sinistra in condizioni di riposo (64%), con evidenza di un'area di infiammazione ed edema miocardico, a distribuzione segmentaria epicardica e sub-epicardica, in corrispondenza della parete laterale del VS, a sede basale e medio-ventricolare, come da miocardite in fase sub-acuta.
translation:
CARDIAC MRI WITH AND WITHOUT CONTRAST

The examination was performed with the patient at rest, utilizing cine and morphological sequences aligned with the main cardiac axes, STIR sequences, and PSIR sequences acquired after intravenous contrast administration in a patient with recent oppressive chest pain, elevated troponin levels, and suspected myocarditis.

Left Ventricle: Normal endocavitary dimensions with a diastolic diameter of 48 mm; preserved systolic function at rest with an overall ejection fraction of 64%.

Left Atrium: Normal dimensions, with no mitral insufficiency.

Right Ventricle: Normal morphology and volume with preserved global systolic function at rest.

Right Atrium: Mildly enlarged dimensions, with slight tricuspid insufficiency.

STIR Sequences: An area of inflammation and edema is noted in the myocardium, specifically in the lateral wall of the left ventricle at the basal and mid-ventricular levels, with an epicardial and sub-epicardial segmental distribution.

Post-contrast Sequences: A faint area of mild enhancement is observed in the lateral wall of the left ventricle at the basal and mid-ventricular levels.

Conclusions: Preserved global left ventricular systolic function at rest (64%), with evidence of an area of myocardial inflammation and edema, with epicardial and sub-epicardial segmental distribution, in the lateral wall of the left ventricle at the basal and mid-ventricular levels, consistent with subacute myocarditis.
